intro: Ligusticum pseudoangelica, commonly known as the Japanese angelica root, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescence. It is native to East Asia and features slender, hollow stems with finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to greenish flowers arranged in umbrella-like clusters, typical of the carrot family. Its rhizome is often harvested for use in traditional medicine and culinary applications. Ligusticum pseudoangelica is valued for its potential medicinal properties, including anti-inflammatory and antioxidant effects.
